title: 114_s517
content: The Act is titled the "Secure Rural Schools and Payment in Lieu of Taxes Repair Act" and extends the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Program. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is amended to define the full funding amount for fiscal years 2012 and 2013, and for fiscal year 2014 onwards as equal to the full funding amount for fiscal year 2011. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is amended to extend availability of payments until 2016 and adjust election deadlines for applicable fiscal years. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is amended to change dates to 2014 and 2016, and adjust election options for counties with major distributions. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is amended to allow eligible counties receiving $350,000 or more to elect to reserve funds for projects, allocate a portion for county payments, or return the balance to the Treasury. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is amended to update election notification, failure to elect consequences, and distribution of payments to eligible counties. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is amended to update project proposal submission deadlines and evaluation processes on federal land. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is amended to update project funds availability and resource advisory committees. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is amended to extend the termination of authority and continuation of county funds reservation until 2016 or later as determined by the Secretary concerned. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is amended to extend the termination of authority and continuation of county funds reservation until September 30, 2017, for specified purposes. Additionally, funds not obligated as required by the Act will be available for use in accordance with title II and III. Title III funds not obligated under the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 will be available for use in accordance with title III of the Act. SEC. 3. Amends Section 6906 of title 31, United States Code, by removing specific fiscal years and making it applicable for any fiscal year.
